header: A Letter to the Captives in Babylon

verse: This is the ·letter [words of the scroll] that Jeremiah the prophet sent from Jerusalem to the remaining elders who were among the ·captives [exiles], the priests, and the prophets. He sent it to all the other people Nebuchadnezzar had taken as ·captives [exiles] from Jerusalem to Babylon [in 597 bc; 2 Kin. 24:12–17; 2 Chr. 36:6–8].

(This ·letter [scroll] was sent after all these people were taken away: Jehoiachin [Jeconiah] the king and the queen mother [Nehushta; 13:18]; the ·officers [servants; eunuchs] and leaders of Judah and Jerusalem; and the craftsmen and metalworkers from Jerusalem.)

Zedekiah king of Judah sent Elasah son of Shaphan [perhaps the court secretary under Josiah; 2 Kin. 22:3, 8–9] and Gemariah son of Hilkiah [perhaps the high priest under Josiah; 2 Kin. 22:8] to Babylon to Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon. So Jeremiah gave them this ·letter [scroll] to carry to Babylon:
Also give a message to Shemaiah from the Nehelamite family.

The Lord ·All-Powerful [Almighty; of Heaven’s Armies; of hosts], the God of Israel, says: “Shemaiah, you sent ·letters [scrolls] in your name to all the people in Jerusalem, to the priest Zephaniah son of Maaseiah, and to all the priests.

You said to Zephaniah, ‘The Lord has made you priest in place of Jehoiada. You are to be in charge of the ·Temple [house] of the Lord. You should arrest any ·madman [crazy person] who acts like a prophet. Place him in stocks [wooden restraints] and put an iron collar around his neck.
Now Jeremiah from Anathoth is acting like a prophet. So why haven’t you ·arrested [rebuked] him?
He [Jeremiah] has sent [this message] to us in Babylon: You will be there for a long time, so build houses and settle down. Plant gardens and eat ·what they grow [their fruit].’”
Zephaniah the priest read ·the letter to [this scroll in the ear of] Jeremiah the prophet.
Then the Lord spoke his word to Jeremiah:

“Send this message to all the ·captives in Babylon [exiles]: ‘This is what the Lord says about Shemaiah the Nehelamite: Shemaiah has prophesied to you, but I did not send him. He has made you ·believe [trust; have confidence in] a lie.

So the Lord says, I will soon punish Shemaiah the Nehelamite and his ·family [seed]. He will not see the good things I will do for my people, says the Lord. None of his family will be left alive among the people, because he has taught the people to ·turn [rebel] against me.’”
